fields.Title: INVENTORY / SUZERAINTY GAME
START
input
You: "Shake the box."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shake the box.

fields.Title: introhub
Rhetoric: "But not good enough, the lieutenant..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But not good enough, the lieutenant seems to be saying.

fields.Title: You: "Fuck the suzerain, what about *my*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fuck the suzerain, what about *my* wealth and renown?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The actual scoring system appears i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The actual scoring system appears infinitely complex, with a series of tables and appendices required to compute each player's final victory point total. You skip that part for now.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You open up a number of pouches con..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You open up a number of pouches containing wooden tokens. There are also several punchboards with other cardboard components that will need to be punched out before you can play.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "In addition to the worker and build..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In addition to the worker and building tokens used by each player, there are also several piles of colourful resource tokens, each representing one of the game's four principal resources...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's a market. It's worth *two v..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's a market. It's worth *two victory points*."

fields.Title: You: "Glower silently."
fields.Dialogue Text: Glower silently.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't worry, it was mostly just lu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't worry, it was mostly just luck. You'll earn some points soon enough."

fields.Title: components hub
Electrochemistry: "Oh, yeah, baby. Cocaine and rock mu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh, yeah, baby. Cocaine and rock music go together like... cocaine and rock music.

fields.Title: You: ""Hmmm, this feels strangely anti-cl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmmm, this feels strangely anti-climactic."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs. "That's the p..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant sighs. "That's the problem with certain games. At some point they just *end*, as though no one expected the players to make it that far..."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Who cares about workers and territo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Who cares about workers and territories when the real action is in Revachol? You spend your turns fulfilling contracts for sweet coins and one-time bonuses.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "It's true. Had you read the rules m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's true. Had you read the rules more carefully this would have been abundantly clear.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs. "There are s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant shrugs. "There are some *paranoid* types who believe the Moralintern keeps detailed score sheets for everyone in the Re√°l Belt, but that's obviously nonsense..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Otherwise, no. There are no points..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Otherwise, no. There are no points, just your actions and the consequences of those actions."

fields.Title: Authority: "Now's your chance. Show the lieuten..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Now's your chance. Show the lieutenant what happens when he patronizes you.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_authority_condescend"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_authority_condescend"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_authority_condescend"])
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Your commitment to doing right by y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your commitment to doing right by your workers pays off and you manage to construct the rarely attempted *public education system*. You truly have the best-educated worker tokens in the entire world...

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Well, the suzerain was looking for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Well, the suzerain was looking for new markets for all the cocaine it was producing, and it settled on Safre...

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Those aren't your *only* options."
fields.Dialogue Text: Those aren't your *only* options.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Holy shit, the average playing tim..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Holy shit, the average playing time for this game is one to *six* hours..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up from his ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks up from his tabulations. "I've got 20 points," he says with measured pride...

fields.Title: You: "Solving the murder?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Solving the murder?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The endgame is upon you. How will y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The endgame is upon you. How will you spend the vast resources you've acquired for the glory of the suzerain?

fields.Title: You: "Remove the plastic wrap."
fields.Dialogue Text: Remove the plastic wrap.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Even before you open it, you can te..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Even before you open it, you can tell that this will be a meaty game of grand strategy and complex player interactions.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "There's a hiss as the lid slides of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's a hiss as the lid slides off. Inside you find a thick, full-colour rulebook and more than a dozen pouches of various wooden components.

fields.Title: You: "I've read enough. (Put the rulebook..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I've read enough. (Put the rulebook away.)

fields.Title: Half Light: "Boring, boring, BORING. Tear up thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Boring, boring, BORING. Tear up this rulebook and commit some old-school atrocities!

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_reaction_tips_read"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_reaction_tips_read"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_reaction_tips_read"])
You: "Pick up where you left off."
fields.Dialogue Text: Pick up where you left off.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""More or less," the lieutenant says..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "More or less," the lieutenant says, but he's thinking less about matters of historical wrongdoing than how to get out of the jam you've put him in...

fields.Title: You: ""For almighty Revachol!" (Go for th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "For almighty Revachol!" (Go for the victory column.)

fields.Title: Jump to: [hubturn2]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, I believe it's your turn...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, I believe it's your turn..."

fields.Title: You: ""Am *I* getting points right now?"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Am *I* getting points right now?" (Look around.)

fields.Title: You: ""Who came up with such a concept?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who came up with such a concept?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Using the substantial coins and res..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Using the substantial coins and resources you've accumulated from diligently fulfilling contracts and constructing trade routes, you spend your final turns constructing the ultimate structure in the game, the Revacholian *victory column*...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A risky gambit, detective. Sorry i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A risky gambit, detective. Sorry it didn't pay off."

fields.Title: You: "Okay, make them work a little, but..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, make them work a little, but not *too* much.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Computing the final scores is almos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Computing the final scores is almost a game unto itself. You each spend an inordinate amount of time making stacks of coins, consulting tables, and struggling with basic addition and multiplication...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Computing the final scores is almos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Computing the final scores is almost a game unto itself. You each spend an inordinate amount of time making stacks of coins, consulting tables, and struggling with basic addition and multiplication...

fields.Title: You: ""Yeah, never play board games.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yeah, never play board games."

fields.Title: You: ""Guess I should have gone with a mo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Guess I should have gone with a more consistent strategy."

fields.Title: Empathy: "So he says, but his gaze lingers a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: So he says, but his gaze lingers a moment longer on the rulebook than is strictly necessary. He could *make* time, if he really wanted to.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "At this point, plain badgering may..."
fields.Dialogue Text: At this point, plain badgering may be your best bet.

fields.Title: You: ""Come on, Kim, *puh-leeeeeze*.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Come on, Kim, *puh-leeeeeze*."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After double- and then triple-check..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After double- and then triple-checking your maths, you have your final score...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After double- and then triple-check..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After double- and then triple-checking your maths, you have your final score...

fields.Title: You: ""Huh, maybe I should have pursued a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Huh, maybe I should have pursued a different strategy."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant opens his mouth as i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant opens his mouth as if to issue a blistering retort, then hesitates...

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "*Drugs*. Specifically uppers. That'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Drugs*. Specifically uppers. That's an itch... in the back of your neck and elsewhere...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Flipping through the manual, you fi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Flipping through the manual, you find the most expensive structure in the game... the Revacholian *victory column*, worth *twelve victory points*. If you can successfully build it, victory will be all-but assured...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Alternatively, you could try launch..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Alternatively, you could try launching a *trade war* to crush the lieutenant's economy, or you could blow all that money on a *public education system* for your worker tokens...

fields.Title: You: "Open the box."
fields.Dialogue Text: Open the box.

fields.Title: Variable["reputation.honour"] >= 1  and  IsTHCPresent("honour") == false
Variable["reputation.honour"] >= 1  and  IsTHCPresent("honour") == false
!(Variable["reputation.honour"] >= 1  and  IsTHCPresent("honour") == false)
You: "How do you accumulate victory point..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How do you accumulate victory points?

fields.Title: You: ""Rock and roll, baby." (Go for the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Rock and roll, baby." (Go for the contract.)

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods gravely as you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant nods gravely as you erect tariffs against his apricots and sugar. This is going to get ugly...

fields.Title: You: "Focus on fulfilling contracts."
fields.Dialogue Text: Focus on fulfilling contracts.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know, detective, there's... so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You know, detective, there's... something *admirable* about that, in its own way..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You should probably pick one strat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You should probably pick one strategy and stick to it. Trying to do a little of everything is usually a bad idea."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Your boondoggle nearly bankrupts th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your boondoggle nearly bankrupts the suzerain's treasury and you suffer a significant penalty to your final score...

fields.Title: Jump to: [suzeraintymainhub]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't be glum, detective. There's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't be glum, detective. There's always next time. Figuratively, I mean. There's no way we have time to play this game again..."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After double- and then triple-check..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After double- and then triple-checking your maths, you have your final score...

fields.Title: You: "You're going to say 'drugs,' aren't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're going to say 'drugs,' aren't you?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The endgame is upon you. What will..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The endgame is upon you. What will be your crowning achievement as the suzerain's territorial administrator?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Ahhh! Savour that new board game sm..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ahhh! Savour that new board game smell! A mix of wood, paper, and ink, all wrapped in the sweet must of cardboard.

fields.Title: suzeraintymainhub
You: "[Put the game away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Put the game away.]

fields.Title: Authority: "Just like there are no *honour poin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just like there are no *honour points*. None whatsoever.

fields.Title: You: "Put the components away."
fields.Dialogue Text: Put the components away.

fields.Title: You: ""It's on, Kim." (Launch a trade war..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's on, Kim." (Launch a trade war.)

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Now it's the lieutenant's turn to r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Now it's the lieutenant's turn to respond. He moves aggressively onto the Safre territory. Soon his workers are producing a steady supply of extremely valuable *apricots*...

fields.Title: You: "Gaze on your workers like a harsh,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Gaze on your workers like a harsh, but proud, deity.

fields.Title: You: ""What's the point of playing a game..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What's the point of playing a game if I can't make my own choices?"

fields.Title: You: "Tell me more."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tell me more.

fields.Title: You: "That's fucked up!"
fields.Dialogue Text: That's fucked up!

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, precisely.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, precisely."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "It's your move."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's your move.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up from his ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks up from his tabulations. "I've got 15 points," he says with a slight smirk on his face...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hey, at least you went out playing..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, at least you went out playing the game how you wanted. There's something to be said for that."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Computing the final scores is almos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Computing the final scores is almost a game unto itself. You each spend an inordinate amount of time making stacks of coins, consulting tables, and struggling with basic addition and multiplication...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Negative five victory points. You'l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Negative five victory points. You'll be lucky if the suzerain doesn't have your whole family executed for such a pitiful performance.

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
Kim Kitsuragi: ""See? I warned you investing in you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "See? I warned you investing in your workers wasn't going to pay off."

fields.Title: You: ""My worker tokens have a right to a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "My worker tokens have a right to an education, Kim."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You can't do that, detective," the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You can't do that, detective," the lieutenant says as you move all of your pieces onto one of his territories.

fields.Title: hubturn3
You: ""I hope you learned your lesson, Ki..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I hope you learned your lesson, Kim."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm bored with this. Let's finish..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm bored with this. Let's finish the game later."

fields.Title: You: ""Okay, let's finish up.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, let's finish up."

Variable["inventory.suzerainty_worker_counter"] > 2
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_worker_counter"] > 2)
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "That's more like it. You produce a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's more like it. You produce a handful of archaeological treasures and a smattering of other resources.

fields.Title: You: ""I make the rules now.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I make the rules now."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You see in Table 8c that investing..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You see in Table 8c that investing in territorial infrastructure multiplies your final victory point total by 1x, which is to say, not at all, whereas erecting monuments in Revachol gives you a multiplier of *5x*..."

fields.Title: Jump to: [suzeraintymainhub]
Jump to: [hubturn2]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""As I recall, it was your turn, det..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "As I recall, it was your turn, detective."

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_left_turn_2"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_left_turn_2"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_left_turn_2"])
Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up from his ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks up from his tabulations. "I've got 20 points," he says, slightly embarrassed at the point differential...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Alternatively, you could throw the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Alternatively, you could throw the whole game away by trying to build a *public education system* for the children of your workers...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Good thinking. It could be a collec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Good thinking. It could be a collectible some day.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "What is detective work if not an el..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What is detective work if not an elaborate game? You need logical inference, attention to detail, the ability to analyse your opponents' motives...

fields.Title: You: ""Hmm, we should probably read the r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmm, we should probably read the rules, huh?"

fields.Title: You: ""I read the rules already, I'll sho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I read the rules already, I'll show you..."

fields.Title: yor_first_choice
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You draw a contract card offering a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You draw a contract card offering a number of coins in exchange for archaeological treasures...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Using your powers of 'persuasion',..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Using your powers of 'persuasion', you 'convince' more workers to join your cause...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's up to you, detective. But r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's up to you, detective. But remember, the objective of the game is to earn victory points for the suzerain..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, not at all. I suspect this is..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, not at all. I suspect this is going to be a rather *low-scoring* game..."

fields.Title: You: ""That's terrifying.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's terrifying."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "There's no concept of *rest* in Suz..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's no concept of *rest* in Suzerainty. Workers have to work. You produce a handful of archaeological treasures and a smattering of other resources.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not going to play with you if..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not going to play with you if you're going to act like a child. Now come on, take your turn."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's a subject for another time...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's a subject for another time. All you need to know is that they're a powerful transnational organization, of which the *Coalition* and by extension the RCM are but one small piece."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Glancing over the board, you see se..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know, detective, there's... so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You know, detective, there's... something *admirable* about that, in its own way..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That might have been a good idea,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That might have been a good idea, yes..."

fields.Title: Jump to: [introhub]
You: "Finally, a proper game to teach chi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Finally, a proper game to teach children about the importance of trade and the global economy.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "That's where the suzerain's vassals..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's where the suzerain's vassals come in. The game features four vassal nations, each one home to an economically important resource...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Each turn the player collects resou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Each turn the player collects resources from vassals where they've placed workers. They may then rearrange their workers, fulfil contracts for coin and bonuses, or build structures back in Revachol...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not sure we can afford to set..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not sure we can afford to set aside *that* kind of time for a *game*."

fields.Title: You: ""*Cha-CHING*, Kim!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Cha-CHING*, Kim!"

fields.Title: Jump to: [components hub]
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After several turns you have a neat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After several turns you have a neat pile of cardboard coins and several units of archaeological treasure, which you trade in to build... a *museum*...

fields.Title: You: ""So what *can* I do?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "So what *can* I do?"

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Nonsense. Remember what the lieuten..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nonsense. Remember what the lieutenant said? If points are arbitrary, who cares about *winning*? You should reject their system and just play how you want.

fields.Title: Composure: "C'mon, is that your game face? You'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: C'mon, is that your game face? You're practically broadcasting your position to the lieutenant with that expression.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You place all of your workers on th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You place all of your workers on the Ile Marat territory. On your next turn you produce six units of archaeological treasure and fulfil the contract for a handful of coins.

fields.Title: You: "Ignore the thought."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ignore the thought.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant scoffs. "In your *dr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant scoffs. "In your *dreams*, maybe. I've thrashed my share of trash-talkers before. Now come on, let's put childish things aside."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "There's also a neat little log to k..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's also a neat little log to keep track of your progress, in case you need to put the game away and return to it later...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmm... this doesn't look right to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmmm... this doesn't look right to me. I think we need to start over, unfortunately..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "In response, the lieutenant spends..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In response, the lieutenant spends two of his sugar and one of his apricot tokens to complete his contract card. He is rewarded with four coins and a round wooden token that he places in the centre of the board...

fields.Title: Interfacing: "A good, orderly task that leaves yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A good, orderly task that leaves you feeling relaxed and accomplished.

fields.Title: You: "Stack the coins in neat little pile..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Stack the coins in neat little piles to annoy the lieutenant.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do realize the game is called..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You do realize the game is called *Suzerainty* and not *Workers' Paradise*, right?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."]
Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."]
You: ""Nope, I'm done." (Start putting th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Nope, I'm done." (Start putting the pieces away.)

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "By introducing cocaine into Safre u..."
fields.Dialogue Text: By introducing cocaine into Safre under exclusive contract, the suzerain created an extremely valuable captive market for an extremely *addictive* product.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_rhetoric_invest"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_rhetoric_invest"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_rhetoric_invest"])
Kim Kitsuragi: ""I hope you learned your lesson," t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I hope you learned your lesson," the lieutenant says with a sharp smile.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Computing the final scores is almos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Computing the final scores is almost a game unto itself. You each spend an inordinate amount of time making stacks of coins, consulting tables, and struggling with basic addition and multiplication...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a sour loo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant gives you a sour look. He may or may not hate fun, but either way he does not appreciate your attitude...

fields.Title: Suggestion: "Have you tried... goading him?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Have you tried... goading him?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "In your hands you hold a brand new..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In your hands you hold a brand new copy of the game 'Suzerainty'. It's snugly wrapped in a skin of plastic...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The box has a nice heft to it. You..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The box has a nice heft to it. You hear the rattle of individual wooden tokens and feel their weight shifting back and forth...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The plastic wrap rips off as easily..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The plastic wrap rips off as easily as a bodice in a tawdry historical romance.

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know, let's wing it.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know, let's wing it."

fields.Title: DayCount() < 2
DayCount() < 2
!(DayCount() < 2)
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You soon figure out the basic conce..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You soon figure out the basic conceit: Each player represents an administrator for the *Suzerain of Revachol*. Your objective is to increase the suzerain's wealth and renown by accumulating *victory points*.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Despite your trash-talking, the lie..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Despite your trash-talking, the lieutenant still has a formidable store of coins and resources...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Despite your conspicuous display of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Despite your conspicuous display of wealth, the lieutenant still has a formidable store of coins and resources...

fields.Title: You: ""Can I go back and do my turn over?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Can I go back and do my turn over?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After several turns your worker tok..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After several turns your worker tokens greatly outnumber the lieutenant's. A vast army of expendable labour is at your command.

fields.Title: You: "Gaze on your workers like a benevol..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Gaze on your workers like a benevolent parent.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmm, too bad investing in your wo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmmm, too bad investing in your workers just isn't worth many points."

fields.Title: hubturn2
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's tally up the scores, shall w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let's tally up the scores, shall we?"

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_points_arbitrary"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_points_arbitrary"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_points_arbitrary"])
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Even in the best of cases it's impo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Even in the best of cases it's impossible to really "win" a trade war. But this is far from the best case, and the lieutenant's apricot-powered economic engine crushes yours...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, let's tally up the scores, sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, let's tally up the scores, shall we?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, let's tally up the scores, sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, let's tally up the scores, shall we?"

fields.Title: Empathy: "Ignore the mock umbrage. Now he wan..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ignore the mock umbrage. Now he wants to prove it to you.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, let's clean up and get back t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, let's clean up and get back to work."

fields.Title: Suggestion: "See? He's doing the hard work himse..."
fields.Dialogue Text: See? He's doing the hard work himself. All he needed was a little nudge...

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The endgame is upon you. What will..."]
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The lieutenant flips through the ma..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant flips through the manual more quickly than you're able to keep up with. Then you each take your bags of tokens and counters and unfold the board between you...

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_mainhub_reached"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_mainhub_reached"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_mainhub_reached"])
Jump to: [suzeraintymainhub]
Reaction Speed: "As you leaf through the pages, your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As you leaf through the pages, your eye catches on a sidebar labelled 'ADVICE FOR BEGINNERS'.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant goes first. He draws..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant goes first. He draws a contract card and moves several of his workers to the Safre territory of the board and the others to the Semenine Islands...

fields.Title: You: ""Hey, why don't I get one of those?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, why don't I get one of those?"

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "Remember what the rulebook said! Yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Remember what the rulebook said! You'll want to choose a strategy early on and stay committed to it.

fields.Title: You: ""Just like they did to Safre.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Just like they did to Safre."
fields.Alternate1: "Isn't this what they did in the Apricot Suzerainty in real life?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have no idea what 'lesson' you t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I have no idea what 'lesson' you think you taught me. Somehow I don't think this is going to work out well for *either* of us..."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Interestingly, this is more or less..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Interestingly, this is more or less what happened in real life as well. To this day, if Iilmaraans want to see their nation's priceless treasures they have to visit Revachol or Gottwald or Sur-la-Clef.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright, detective. Your turn.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright, detective. Your turn."

fields.Title: You: "Put the game away."
fields.Dialogue Text: Put the game away.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."]
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Fifteen victory points. The suzerai..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fifteen victory points. The suzerain will not be impressed.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up from his ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks up from his tabulations. "I've got 15 points," he says...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "As he completes his own contract ca..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As he completes his own contract card, the lieutenant is rewarded with four coins and a round wooden token that he places in the centre of the board...

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Feels good, doesn't it? But you kno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Feels good, doesn't it? But you know what would feel even *better*?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Or do you ignore his aggression and..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Or do you ignore his aggression and focus on building the mighty *victory column* structure in Revachol herself?

fields.Title: Suggestion: "What, does the lieutenant hate fun?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What, does the lieutenant hate fun? Is he the *fun* police?

fields.Title: You: "Isn't there any way to invade or co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Isn't there any way to invade or commit atrocities or anything fun like that?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, those are nice." The lieutenan..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, those are nice." The lieutenant picks up a sugar token and admires it.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, let's tally up the scores, sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, let's tally up the scores, shall we?"

fields.Title: You: "Give back to the workers."
fields.Dialogue Text: Give back to the workers.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I suppose you could try fulf..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, I suppose you could try fulfilling some contracts, or you might try to relocate your workers. There are any number of strategies open to you."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm just trying to do right by the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just trying to do right by the people who actually generate the suzerain's wealth."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The choice is yours."
fields.Dialogue Text: The choice is yours.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's just the way it is." The li..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's just the way it is." The lieutenant doesn't seem to find much value in dwelling on the subject...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods. "Now, I believ..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant nods. "Now, I believe it's your turn..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure?" The lieutenant look..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Are you sure?" The lieutenant looks a little disappointed. "It's going to take a while to set everything up again."

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: ""Remember, there are many paths to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Remember, there are many paths to victory in *Suzerainty*, but successful players will find *one* strategy and commit to it wholeheartedly."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "There's a reason very few players e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's a reason very few players ever attempt to built a public education system for their worker tokens: It's extremely expensive and never pays off, by design...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Two points. Though you're beloved b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Two points. Though you're beloved by your well-educated worker tokens, the suzerain is immensely displeased, and recalls you from your post.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, there's always next time. Fi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, there's always next time. Figuratively, I mean. There's no way we have time to play this game again..."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."]
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You could attempt to build the migh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You could attempt to build the mighty *victory column* structure, or launch a *trade war* against the lieutenant, or spend everything to build a *public education system* for your worker tokens...

fields.Title: You: "Examine the components."
fields.Dialogue Text: Examine the components.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright, you've convinced me. How..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright, you've convinced me. How do we play?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Apricots from Safre, archaeological..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Apricots from Safre, archaeological treasures from Ile Marat, sugar from the Semenine Islands, and magenta cocaine from Supramundi and Saramiriza...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "There is no path to wealth and reno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There is no path to wealth and renown but through the suzerain. As one of the suzerain's trusted administrators, your very function is the glorification of Revachol...

fields.Title: You: "How is the winner determined?"
fields.Dialogue Text: How is the winner determined?

fields.Title: You: "Check out the wooden tokens."
fields.Dialogue Text: Check out the wooden tokens.

fields.Title: You: "Let your workers rest for a while."
fields.Dialogue Text: Let your workers rest for a while.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "It takes several turns, but you slo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It takes several turns, but you slowly begin accumulating the cocaine necessary to complete the contract. When you do, it practically rains cardboard coins on your side...

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_column_counter"] > 2
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_column_counter"] > 2
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_column_counter"] > 2)
You: ""Behold my vast accomplishments.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Behold my vast accomplishments."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You place a cylindrical piece of wo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You place a cylindrical piece of wood on the Revachol section in the middle of the board. It's meant to stand in for a beautifully adorned edifice filled with ancient wonders.

fields.Title: You: "Attack the lieutenant and steal all..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Attack the lieutenant and steal all his resources.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is a game of *economic* strat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This is a game of *economic* strategy. You can't directly attack the other players. You'll have to do something else."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now we find out what's left of our..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now we find out what's left of our economies..."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm bored with this. Let's do some..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm bored with this. Let's do something else."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Soon your coffers are empty and the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Soon your coffers are empty and the map lies strewn with your worker tokens.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Computing the final scores is almos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Computing the final scores is almost a game unto itself. You each spend an inordinate amount of time making stacks of coins, consulting tables, and struggling with basic addition and multiplication...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't be a sore loser, detective...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't be a sore loser, detective. Your moves were your own..."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The endgame is upon you. What will..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks over the ruleb..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks over the rulebook before he sees something that makes his eyes go wide...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're nice tokens, yes. Very imp..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They're nice tokens, yes. Very impressive..."

fields.Title: You: "Invest in your existing workers."
fields.Dialogue Text: Invest in your existing workers.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Soon your workers have access to cl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Soon your workers have access to clean water, paved roads, and basic hobbies. In return they produce... one extra resource per turn.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant continues his strate..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant continues his strategy of aggressively producing apricots for export. He fulfils contract after contract, racking up ever more victory points...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The endgame is upon you. What will..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The endgame is upon you. What will be your crowning achievement as the suzerain's territorial administrator?

fields.Title: You: ""Hmmm, that wasn't very productive..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmmm, that wasn't very productive for *either* of us, was it?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Game designers, I imagine.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Game designers, I imagine."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""An aggressive opening, detective,"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "An aggressive opening, detective," the lieutenant says, appearing to relish the challenge.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "You could also show your workers ho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You could also show your workers how much you appreciate them by *investing* some of that wealth in them. After all, they're the ones *producing* wealth for the suzerain.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That might have helped, yes...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That might have helped, yes..."

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_kim_wc_failed_twice"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_kim_wc_failed_twice"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_kim_wc_failed_twice"])
You: "Put the game away."
fields.Dialogue Text: Put the game away.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_left_turn_3"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_left_turn_3"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_left_turn_3"])
Kim Kitsuragi: ""As I recall, it was your turn, det..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "As I recall, it was your turn, detective."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up from his ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks up from his tabulations. "I've got 26 points," he says, a barely contained smile breaking out across his face...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, let's tally up the scores, sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, let's tally up the scores, shall we?"

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "*Drugs*. Specifically uppers. Speak..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Drugs*. Specifically uppers. Speaking of, aren't you supposed to be looking for some right about *now*?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The endgame is upon you. Do you esc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The endgame is upon you. Do you escalate the *trade war* with the lieutenant in hopes of crushing him with your economic might?

fields.Title: You: "[Leave it perfect and undisturbed.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Leave it perfect and undisturbed.]

fields.Title: You: ""Who died and made you the fun poli..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who died and made you the fun police?"

fields.Title: You: "Punch out the cardboard pieces, one..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Punch out the cardboard pieces, one by one.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Each cardboard token makes a satisf..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Each cardboard token makes a satisfying *chhhk* as you pop it out. Soon a neat pile of cardboard coins and counters has accumulated before you.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""What, you're not going to offer to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What, you're not going to offer to let *me* punch any of them out?"

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
You: ""Kim, what should I do?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, what should I do?"

fields.Title: You: ""Kim, can I do my first turn over?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, can I do my first turn over? I think I messed up."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The workers are just there to prod..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The workers are just there to produce raw resources. You're not supposed to worry about them too much."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because the way you earn points is..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Because the way you earn points is by pleasing the suzerain, and the player with the most points wins the game."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "For several turns you struggle to r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: For several turns you struggle to respond to the lieutenant's burgeoning apricot empire. Eventually you relocate the majority of your workers to Supramundi and Saramiriza, where they begin producing a bumper crop of cocaine tokens...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think the suzerain *cares*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't think the suzerain *cares* much about the welfare of its workers. Here, watch this..."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm not even sure what points *are..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not even sure what points *are* -- that's part of the problem."

fields.Title: Authority: "What is that patronizing tone? You'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What is that patronizing tone? You're one of the suzerain's trusted administrators! You may need to put the lieutenant in his place...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Building the ultimate structure req..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Building the ultimate structure requires diligent economic planning, which you completely failed to do...

fields.Title: You: "Let them rest anyway."
fields.Dialogue Text: Let them rest anyway.

fields.Title: You: "Can you even *do* that?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Can you even *do* that?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Well, sure, you *can* do that. It's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Well, sure, you *can* do that. It's just not a terribly *effective* strategy. But then, it's up to you...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmm, I do feel like my thinking h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmmm, I do feel like my thinking has become somewhat *rigid*. Maybe a little diversion to keep the mind limber is just what's in order..."

fields.Title: You: "Keep playing."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep playing.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After double- and then triple-check..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After double- and then triple-checking your maths, you have your final score...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After double- and then triple-check..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After double- and then triple-checking your maths, you have your final score...

fields.Title: You: ""You taught me that points are arbi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You taught me that points are arbitrary. I decided to play the game how I wanted instead."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see you bring the same *unorthod..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I see you bring the same *unorthodox technique* to playing board games as you do to detective work..."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You have a few options available to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You have a few options available to you: Will you try to fulfil contracts right away or rearrange your workers to maximize production on future turns?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "It's a shame there's no one for you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's a shame there's no one for you to play with.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "With each passing turn you slowly b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: With each passing turn you slowly bleed the lieutenant of coins as his own workers become less productive and more dependent on your magenta cocaine tokens.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A little late for that, I think...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "A little late for that, I think..."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "With a triumphant flourish, you rem..."
fields.Dialogue Text: With a triumphant flourish, you remove a rectangular token from one of the satchels and place it in the centre of the board...
fields.Alternate1: With a triumphant flourish, you remove a rectangular token from one of the satchels and place it next to your museum-cylinder in the centre of the board...

fields.Title: You: "Just do whatever Kim did."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just do whatever Kim did.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You move a few of your workers to t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You move a few of your workers to the Ile Marat section of the board and several others to Supramundi and Saramiriza. Soon you have several units of archaeological treasure and cocaine.

fields.Title: You: ""But what about the workers?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "But what about the workers?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You could continue your efforts to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You could continue your efforts to win the hearts of your worker tokens by building the rarely attempted *public education system* for your territories...

fields.Title: You: ""You taught me that points are arbi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You taught me that points are arbitrary. I decided to play the game how I wanted instead."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Unfortunately, you were sent to the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Unfortunately, you were sent to the territories to produce raw resources, not overly educated second-class citizens. If anything, this might *negatively* impact your final score.

fields.Title: You: ""Yeah, never get involved in a trad..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yeah, never get involved in a trade war in Insulinde."

fields.Title: You: ""This dumb game is rigged, rigged I..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This dumb game is rigged, rigged I say!"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs so hard for a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant sighs so hard for a moment it seems like he may asphyxiate...

fields.Title: Variable["TASK.get_speed"] == true  and  Variable["TASK.get_speed_done"] == false
Variable["TASK.get_speed"] == true  and  Variable["TASK.get_speed_done"] == false
!(Variable["TASK.get_speed"] == true  and  Variable["TASK.get_speed_done"] == false)
You: "Convince Kim to play with you."
fields.Dialogue Text: Convince Kim to play with you.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_suggestion_wc"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_suggestion_wc"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_suggestion_wc"])
You: ""Come on, it might help us think of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Come on, it might help us think of more creative solutions to the case."

fields.Title: You: "Hmmm, this history seems *problemat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hmmm, this history seems *problematic*, but it *is* important to teach children basic economic concepts.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You draw a new contract card. Accor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You draw a new contract card. According to the text, there's an aristocrat willing to trade a large supply of cocaine for a number of coins and access to a rare bonus: amplified music, worth *seven victory points*...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "With every turn tariffs are raised,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: With every turn tariffs are raised, until neither you nor the lieutenant are producing any income or generating resources for the suzerain...

fields.Title: You: "Build a public education system for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Build a public education system for your workers.

fields.Title: Half Light: "How can you let the lieutenant *dom..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How can you let the lieutenant *dominate* you like that? You need to hit back, and *hard*!

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Points are nothing. They don't exi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Points are nothing. They don't exist. They're just an arbitrary convention that games use to reward or punish players for certain behaviours."

fields.Title: Authority: "What is that patronizing tone? Some..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What is that patronizing tone? Someone needs to put the lieutenant in his place.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_reaction_tips_saw"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_reaction_tips_saw"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_reaction_tips_saw"])
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Rather than build a glorious monume..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Rather than build a glorious monument to Revachol's economic superiority, you have to settle for a handful of post offices and school for the blind.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not bad, detective.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Not bad, detective."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "You know, this isn't *unlike* the s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know, this isn't *unlike* the situation the historical Revacholian suzerainty faced in Safre in the middle of the last century...

fields.Title: You: ""What do you mean?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you mean?"

fields.Title: You: ""So you're saying I fucked up?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "So you're saying I fucked up?"

fields.Title: You: ""So you're saying the values of the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "So you're saying the values of the ruling class are completely divorced from the well-being of the people who generate their wealth?"

fields.Title: You: ""What's the... Moralintern?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What's the... Moralintern?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant goes first. He draws..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up from his ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks up from his tabulations. "I've got 26 points," he says, slightly disappointed...

fields.Title: You: ""This stupid game is rigged.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "This stupid game is rigged."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""When I thrash you I want to make s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "When I thrash you I want to make sure it's *by the book*."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "From the Empire of Safre: orange ap..."
fields.Dialogue Text: From the Empire of Safre: orange apricot tokens. From Ile Marat (the ancestral name of Iilmaraa): gray marble block tokens. From the Semenine Islands: white sacks of sugar tokens. And from Supramundi and Saramiriza: magenta tokens for unprocessed cocaine leaves.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Suzerainty is a family game. The on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Suzerainty is a family game. The only 'atrocities' you'll be committing are against the social standing of your rival administrators, as you bring in ever more resources and power for the suzerain. Speaking of...

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."]
IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "What? It's the very beginning of th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What? It's the very beginning of the game. Your workers haven't even done any work yet.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You've reached a critical strategic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've reached a critical strategic juncture. How do you respond to the lieutenant's aggression?

fields.Title: You: ""Sorry, Kim, you're not going to li..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sorry, Kim, you're not going to like this..." (Introduce the lieutenant's workers to cocaine.)

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hrm..." The lieutenant's face goes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hrm..." The lieutenant's face goes stony as you take your turn. He does not appreciate you getting all his workers addicted to cocaine...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Realising victory is slipping away,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Realising victory is slipping away, the lieutenant launches a desperate gambit: *Protectionism*. By erecting tariffs on your cocaine he hopes to starve you out of the market at the risk of incurring the suzerain's disfavour...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Glancing over the board, you see se..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Glancing over the board, you see several possible strategies: Pressing more workers into service would increase your economic output and help you survive a possible conflict with the lieutenant, or you could ignore your labour supply and focus on fulfilling contracts for points and resources...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "To the lieutenant's puzzlement, you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: To the lieutenant's puzzlement, you spend several turns building various improvements to your territorial infrastructure...

fields.Title: You: ""What do you mean? I just did.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you mean? I just did."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Alternatively you could actually tr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Alternatively you could actually try to win the game by building the extremely valuable *victory column* in Revachol or by crushing the lieutenant in a devastating *trade war*...

fields.Title: dem_vict_points
You: ""I'm rejecting the arbitrary so-cal..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm rejecting the arbitrary so-called 'points' system developed by this game's politically compromised game designers."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm bored with this. Let's finish..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm bored with this. Let's finish the game later."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""C'mon, detective. This is the endg..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "C'mon, detective. This is the endgame! Let's just finish up quickly."

fields.Title: You: "Read the advice."
fields.Dialogue Text: Read the advice.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_trade_war_counter"] > 2
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_trade_war_counter"] > 2
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_trade_war_counter"] > 2)
Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant opens his mouth as i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant opens his mouth as if to issue a blistering retort, then hesitates...

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_encyclo_safre"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_encyclo_safre"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_encyclo_safre"])
You: "That's brilliant."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's brilliant.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Never fuck with Kim Kitsuragi.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Never fuck with Kim Kitsuragi."

fields.Title: You: ""You just chickening out because yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You just chickening out because you know I'd crush your ass."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You've reached a critical strategic..."]
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Fifteen victory points. Whether you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fifteen victory points. Whether you win or not, the suzerain is unlikely to be pleased at the loss to productivity caused by his subordinates' shenanigans.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A tie," he says, with evident irri..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A tie," he says, with evident irritation. "Well, I suppose that's what we deserve for trashing the suzerain's economy. Good game, detective."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Negative five victory points. You'l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Negative five victory points. You'll be lucky if the suzerain doesn't have your whole family executed for such a pitiful performance.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ouch," the lieutenant says, cringi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ouch," the lieutenant says, cringing at your spectacular failure.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Come on, detective, you knew the r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Come on, detective, you knew the rules of the game going in..."

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_electro_drugs"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_electro_drugs"]

Variable["inventory.suzerainty_suggestion_wc"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_suggestion_wc"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_suggestion_wc"])
do_the_hub_quick
Electrochemistry: "*Drugs*. Specifically uppers. You s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Drugs*. Specifically uppers. You should find some the first chance you get.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "'Welcome to Suzerainty: A game of e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: 'Welcome to Suzerainty: A game of economic strategy for the whole family!' The rulebook is sumptuously illustrated and thick as a Graadian novel.

fields.Title: You: "Try to fulfil a contract."
fields.Dialogue Text: Try to fulfil a contract.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Meanwhile, the lieutenant spends tw..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Meanwhile, the lieutenant spends two of his sugar and one of his apricot tokens to complete his contract card. He is rewarded with four coins and a round wooden token that he places in the centre of the board...

fields.Title: You: "Say nothing."
fields.Dialogue Text: Say nothing.

fields.Title: You: "Press more workers into service."
fields.Dialogue Text: Press more workers into service.

fields.Title: Jump to: [hubturn3]
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Soon the entire board is a field of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Soon the entire board is a field of economic carnage. Worker tokens lie strewn across the board, which is also bereft of valuable resources.

fields.Title: You: ""What happens now?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What happens now?"

fields.Title: You: ""Oh, that makes sense.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, that makes sense."

fields.Title: You: ""That's reassuring.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's reassuring."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure?" The lieutenant look..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Are you sure?" The lieutenant looks a little disappointed. "It's going to take a while to set everything up again."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, *winning* is usually the poi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, *winning* is usually the point of playing games. Here, watch this..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Take a look at the scoring tables..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Take a look at the scoring tables in the back..." The lieutenant turns to one of those appendices you skipped over earlier...

fields.Title: You: ""So you're saying I should treat my..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "So you're saying I should treat my workers like disposable labour instead?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Thirty-five victory points! The suz..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Thirty-five victory points! The suzerain will be extremely pleased.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like you won convincingly......"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Looks like you won convincingly... well played, detective."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright, detective, you win. How d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright, detective, you win. How do we play this game?"

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "What treasures wait in store for yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What treasures wait in store for you?

fields.Title: You: "Read the rulebook."
fields.Dialogue Text: Read the rulebook.

fields.Title: You: ""Hey, Kim, wanna play?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, Kim, wanna play?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You explain the basic set up proced..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You explain the basic set up procedures to the lieutenant, who seems to be a quick study. You each take your bags of tokens and counters and unfold the board between you...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "In the centre is the crown of Revac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In the centre is the crown of Revachol. Radiating outward are her colourful vassals, each one supplying some raw material desired by the suzerain...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The 'Suzerainty' box is heavy and s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The 'Suzerainty' box is heavy and slightly awkward in your hands. You give it a light shake, and feel the pieces shift around inside.

fields.Title: You: "'Economic strategy'? More like rapa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: 'Economic strategy'? More like rapacious plunder and exploitation.

fields.Title: You: "Finally, a proper game to teach Rev..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Finally, a proper game to teach Revacholian children about their glorious history.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The colourful illustrations depict..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The colourful illustrations depict cheerful workers picking apricots, hauling marble sculptures out of crumbling temples, and harvesting a strange, magenta-leafed plant. Everyone is smiling.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The instructions are opaque at firs..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The instructions are opaque at first, and introduce many concepts you're not familiar with. Fortunately, there are many diagrams and examples throughout...

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "You begin to suspect there may be a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You begin to suspect there may be a *political* agenda to this so-called 'family game'. Only one way to find out...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "You hold the open game box before y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You hold the open game box before you.

fields.Title: Jump to: [components hub]
Encyclopedia: "As a matter of historical fact, thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As a matter of historical fact, this is almost *exactly* what happened in Safre. To this day, fully half of the former Safre Empire remains dependant on international aid in exchange for a steady supply of cheap produce.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "What do you do?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What do you do?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well played, detective. That museu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well played, detective. That museum is worth three victory points..."

fields.Title: You: ""Why don't we say 'screw the suzera..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why don't we say 'screw the suzerain' and keep it all for ourselves?"

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Instead of focussing on amassing po..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Instead of focussing on amassing points, you embark on a quixotic project to win the hearts of your worker tokens. After several turns you've unlocked advanced hobbies and health insurance. Your workers now produce an extra two resources per turn...

fields.Title: Jump to: [suzeraintymainhub]
Conceptualization: "If points are really *arbitrary*, a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If points are really *arbitrary*, as the lieutenant says, what's to stop you from playing the game the way *you* want?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, you're *really* sticking it t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, you're *really* sticking it to the game designers, just like I'm about to stick it to *you*..."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "With your army of cheap, not-cocain..."
fields.Dialogue Text: With your army of cheap, not-cocaine-addicted labour, you're able to survive the tit-for-tat of the trade war, though it leaves both your and the lieutenant's economies worse-off than before...

fields.Title: You: "What does that have to do with the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What does that have to do with the game?

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Computing the final scores is almos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Computing the final scores is almost a game unto itself. You each spend an inordinate amount of time making stacks of coins, consulting tables, and struggling with basic addition and multiplication...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, let's tally up the scores, sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, let's tally up the scores, shall we?"

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.suzerainty_kim_wc_failed_once"]
Variable["inventory.suzerainty_kim_wc_failed_once"]
!(Variable["inventory.suzerainty_kim_wc_failed_once"])
Suzerainty: The Board Game: "After double- and then triple-check..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After double- and then triple-checking your maths, you have your final score...

fields.Title: You: "Winning the game?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Winning the game?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "While you daydream about speed, the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: While you daydream about speed, the lieutenant has built himself a formidable economic engine of his own...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The cover features a charming illus..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The cover features a charming illustration depicting a mass of grinning labourers loading goods onto a ship while a richly dressed administrator oversees their work.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "The exact location and time period..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The exact location and time period are left deliberately vague, but it's clearly meant to represent the economic relationship between the Revacholian Suzerainty and its many vassals.

fields.Title: You: "Keep reading."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep reading.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant returns your baleful..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant returns your baleful look with a satisfied grin.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Noble as that sentiment may be, it..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Noble as that sentiment may be, it's not exactly a *winning* strategy in a game that revolves around resource extraction and exploitation..."

fields.Title: You: "Grimace at them for not working har..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Grimace at them for not working harder.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Come on, detective, don't be a spo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Come on, detective, don't be a spoil sport. You'll have plenty of chances to earn your own points."

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "It takes a while, but you and the l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It takes a while, but you and the lieutenant manage to put everything more or less where it was...

fields.Title: pointsminihub
You: "Take pity on their miserable lives."
fields.Dialogue Text: Take pity on their miserable lives.

fields.Title: Volition: "The lieutenant assumes you're playi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant assumes you're playing by the rules as written. But what's the point of playing if you can't make your own choices?

fields.Title: You: "Ignore it. Just tell me how the win..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ignore it. Just tell me how the winner is determined.

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "The lieutenant isn't joking. You'd..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant isn't joking. You'd better stop fooling around.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "If you could somehow get the lieute..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If you could somehow get the lieutenant's workers *addicted* to your cocaine, you could not only make them less productive, you would also force the lieutenant to *pay* you for your cocaine tokens *each turn*...

fields.Title: Suzerainty: The Board Game: "Yes, you can. It's right there in t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, you can. It's right there in the rules...

fields.Title: You: "Keep playing."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep playing.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't look too glum, detective. Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't look too glum, detective. There's always next time. Figuratively, I mean. There's no way we have time to play this game again..."
